data.title: Golden Globes

data.text: Liv Ullmann (born in Tokyo, Japan, of Norwegian parents, December 16, 1938) was directed by Swedish filmmaker Ingmar Bergman in the movies Persona (1966) with Bibi Andersson, The Passion of Anna (1969) with Max von Sydow, Cries and Whispers (1972) with Ingrid Thulin, Autumn Sonata (1978) with Ingrid Bergman, Face to Face (1976) and the television miniseries Scenes from a Marriage (1973) with Erland Josephson, by Jan Troell in the Swedish film The Emigrants (1971) with Max von Sydow. Ullman directed the Danish film Sofie (1992), the Swedish film Faithless (2000) from a script by Ingmar Bergman, the English film Miss Julie (2014) from the 1888 Swedish play by August Strindberg, with Jessica Chastain, Colin Farrell, Samantha Morton.
